metadata.job_to_be_done: Create and manage fillable forms for onboarding and compliance.

extracted_sections.section_title: Create a PDF and send it for review
An interactive form contains fields that you can select or fill in.
add an image of your initials and then select Done.

subsection_analysis.refined_text: Fill and Sign PDF Forms You can easily fill, sign, and share your documents using Acrobat's Fill & Sign tool. Types of PDF forms
For Microsoft Office applications, such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, click the Create And Share button on the Acrobat ribbon.
1. Open the file in the application used to create it.
3. Specify the users that can open the PDF, and then click OK:
• (Interactive or flat form) To print the form and the typed entries, choose Document. This option prints text that you’ve typed using the Add Text tool.
• (Interactive or flat form) To print the form, the typed entries, and any comments on the form, choose Document And Markups. This option prints text that you’ve typed using the Add Text tool.
3. In the Comments And Forms menu, choose one of the following, and then select OK:
2. To adjust the placement of your signature, hover over it until you see a plus
1. From the Quick actions toolbar, select Add your signature or initials . Select Add Initials. Your initials appear in the field.
3. To adjust the size of your signature, hover over the blue circle at the corner and
4. In the Auto-Complete Entry List dialog box, do one of the following, and then
• To remove all entries, select Remove All.
• To remove some of the entries, select the entries and click Remove. (Shift- select to select multiple adjacent entries; Ctrl-select to select multiple nonadjacent entries.)
• (Interactive or flat form) To print the form and the typed entries, choose Document. This option prints text that you’ve typed using the Add Text tool.
• (Interactive or flat form) To print the form, the typed entries, and any comments on the form, choose Document And Markups. This option prints text that you’ve typed using the Add Text tool.
3. In the Comments And Forms menu, choose one of the following, and then select OK:
